headline: Steer Clear
pros: The only thing I liked about working here is the fellow FSA’s. It made coming to work really nice and we bonded over the mutual dread of coming to work here
cons: The salary to start. Constant promise of bonuses and career progressions that never come. There are people still working there after 10+ years and are not any further in the company, despite being knowledgeable and with a fantastic work ethic. Unrealistic KPI’s and measurements from above. Zero flexible working. You clock on at your start time, clock in and out of breaks, and clock off. If you don’t adhere to that strict schedule your KPI’s will be impacted. Also had a manager say that if we made a mistake he was going to jump from the balcony.

- No work life balance or compassion to employees

headline: A company stuck in 1990
pros:
- Work life balance
- Flexibility
cons:
A company suffering from active inertia. Where the new leadership are trying to bring back the glory days of 1990. And their method of choice is to change the company structure back to all the old ways of working that do not work in 2022. And double down on all the past failed strategies that have failed before.

If your competitors in the advised, high net worth space are innovating. And your competitors in the direct market have the scale to kill you on cost at every turn. Maybe rethink the moronic strategy that you can race them to the bottom on cost and fees. Because HostPlus and AusSuper will beat you direct to consumer with a cheaper, better offer. And you won't have focused any energy or time on the innovation required to beat your competitors in the advised market. HUB, NetWealth and Macquarie will innovate you to death and corner advice relationships.

Especially when the entire customer experience is a paper quagmire. Imagine. Asking customers to do everything on paper in 2022. With the strategies to fix it ignored and not invested in. The amount of consultants that have come through and said the same thing to the business and management is insane - fix experience, fix paper servicing, improve data quality, invest in digital.

Instead you have old Grandpa 1990 and his merry band of waterfall IT practitioners running the show. All thinking if you pre-pop some paper you're cutting edge.

This company is going nowhere and until the management is fired and replaced it will continue going absolutely nowhere.

headline: Micromanaging
pros: Initially it was good when associated with CBA, the first TL, she was really good knew what she was doing.
cons:
The management changed so did Team leaders and managers and the current TL doesn't know anything related to the department processing or work, no assistance given to team members except for dictating around and micromanaging with no flexibility or freedom. They should understand this is not a school or a militant camp and employees should be treated as an adult cause they have to have work life balance. Some people like to work at their own pace although KPIs are important it shouldn't merely depend on the tight work schedule of time what is important is work to be finished within deadline. 
Too much demotivation due to this and this will effect work efficiency. 
When the company itself is underperforming and has lack of discipline on a management level they complain of performance issues to the entry level employees with huge volumes and loads of work for less pay. 
I would say a big no to this Company.

headline: Do yourself a favour and AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

Technology stack is a joke, people are focussed on the wrong things ie: covering themselves and justifying why something is/isn't done. They work you to the bone for nothing in return. This is the type of place where the 'LT' will walk around the office sulking and avoid saying hello to everyone. Yet they will ask why are our engagement scores so low.

headline: Avoid at all cost!!
pros: A terrible leader was finally removed from her position, no surprise as she had no ability to lead a team. Unfortunately took a bit for CFS to finally realise this. Besides that absolutely not a single thing good about working here at CFS Investor Services.
cons: Management is absolutely poor, NO support provided whatsoever, unfortunately I was put in the poorly managed team with a toxic team manager and a immature leader. Something serious has to be done here in order for investor service EVER to have a likely chance of employees actually enjoying their employment here. Specific leaders and manager needs to be removed from their position and for someone skilled and professional to take their place, who actually cares about people within their team and not only about their image.

headline: Used to be very good, but tougher times have created a siege mentality
pros: Pay is solid. Company culture takes inclusivity, work/life balance, and employee comfort seriously. Initial role training is often comprehensive. Bonus of up to 10% of base pay per year. Discounts on CBA banking products, like loans.
cons: Significant manger churn. Very slow to replace staff who leave (3+ months) leading to a state of perpetual understaffing in many operational areas. Additionally, the development of junior staff is spotty/inconsistent - leading many to feel "stuck".

headline: Sick  work environment
pros: may be if you like to work in suburb and not in CBD
cons:
This is one the worst company to work for. especially for testing.

They treat worker not well at all, two managers and they will have close look at you every time as 
 if they own this company, work environment is pathetic, complex system , tight deadline, less resources and without giving proper training they would put you in complex project and expect you to perform same way as experience people are doing. 

They will review your work closely and try to find out minimal issues say even if you refereed or copied few steps from existing test cases they will make  hue n cry. I found most worker scared of management.

Even some colleagues are not very helpful, there will be politics and backbites.

I would have given zero star to it.
